page.syntax: Text as C = ScanToSmatch as C(pattern as c)

argument.name: Text
argument.description: The text between the starting and ending offset positions.

argument.name: pattern
argument.description: The text that you want to find. You may use the "?" (single character) and "*" (any number of characters) expressions.

page.description: Skip until a patterns is encountered. Return text we scanned over.
page.discussion: The <StringScanner>.ScanToSmatch() function moves the offset to the beginning of the Find_Text and returns the text between the starting and ending positions of the offset.
page.example: dim scanner as P dim txt as C txt = <<%text% This is wonderful prose written by a technical writer of great merit. %text% scanner = stringscanner.create(txt) ? scanner.ScanToSmatch("gr*t") = This is wonderful prose written by a technical writer of ? scanner.GetToOffset() = This is wonderful prose written by a technical writer of ? scanner.getremainder() = great merit.
